text: any word on when the shopify/HS beta will be available or the ecom bridge? I'd like to be able to get into those as we have some clients looking to move to HS from WP and I want to make sure we can successfully do this (even if its in beta at the moment)
I was just told yesterday it'll be Jan before beta is opened up to anyone
thanks <@U26C29XPH>

Hey all, question for you guys, *have any of you tried using Zurb's Foundation for Emails with HubSpot*? I only ask because I hit kind of a conundrum.

So I built an email template with foundation, now I'm in the process of converting it to work with HubSpot. In foundation - I'm not inlining the CSS as it seems like a better idea to have HubSpot inline it, that way the email is easier to edit inside HS. The CSS is all in a stylesheet that gets included into the html email in a style tag, then gets inlined by the HubSpot inliner.

Problem is because I'm having HubSpot do the inlining it breaks once it hits the first media query. HubSpot's inliner doesn't know how to do what the Foundation one does - where it separates media queries into a style tag instead of inlining.


Only solution I know will work is to not use the HubSpot Inliner at all and instead rely on the foundation inliner, the email code will be hell to read in HubSpot, so the only way to update the email will be to use the foundation version to update it, run the inliner, and update the code on HubSpot again.

Anyone have any thoughts?
I had this question also. Ended up just avoiding media queries altogether and sitcking to what I could do with tables.

Thanks for responding. I know you can get media queries to work by having a separate style tag that doesn't have the data attribute and id. So if you weren't using foundation, that might help solve the issues you were having.
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/cos/email-template-markup#hs-inline-css-and-data-hse-inline-css>

it seems like if I could just get foundation to build two separate css files(one with media queries and one without) I could make this work, I just have no idea how to go about doing that.

We're having a caching issue right now where a blog post is not busting through the cache of a custom module.

We have a custom module on this site's homepage: <https://www.bradleyimpactfund.org/>
That module pulls in the blog feed and displays the most recent posts

a new post was published "The Gift of Gratitude" <https://www.bradleyimpactfund.org/blog>

anyone got any ideas to bust the cache here? - and HS devs can we please get these caching issues resolved, they're causing all kinds of issues.

Things I've tried
*editing homepage and publishing.
*editing blog post and publishing again
*Editing custom module and publishing again
lists of blog posts have always been cached for 4 hours

that's not true at all. We've been doing hubl blog post listings for over 2 years and they never cached like this until the cloudflare change occured.

and even if it WERE true, that would be terrible PR for HubSpot. - We're the top of the line marketing platform, but you want to announce a product release via a blog post? don't worry your carefully planned launch will happen 4 hours after you wanted it to.
<@U6TBZ66FN> tagging you as you had been working on the caching issues before. Hope you can help, and that this helps you get more info to solve this for everyone.
I'm having problems wiht a css file on the gliffy site so I just created a new one again
<@U7SL518D6> Your recent blog posts module only selects the recent blog posts with the `homepage` tag
You haven't added a `homepage` tag to that new blog post which is why you aren't seeing it
I used hs_debug=true and I no longer am having issues with the css page caching
I think you mean `?hsDebug=true`

You appear to be correct - though updating the post to have the tag, still doesn't make it appear - it's still cached. Upon editing the homepage though the post does appear. I will hold off on publishing the homepage(which will probably bust the cache) in case you want to see that issue.
I see it coming through: <https://www.bradleyimpactfund.org/>
Unless the page is still cached in your browser
used hard refresh(cmd+shift+r) I'll try again maybe I looked too soon
yea, it's on me.. there was just a short delay.
sometimes all it takes is a random url query. I use `?123` all the time
you know thats what I mean
lol you don't think it -- that other stuff I typed doesn't work
camelcase in front end stuff ack

I am working on this issue right now. I am surprised that "editing homepage and publishing" did not work. It should invalidate the cache for the homepage, and it should pickup the changes of all its dependencies.
wait, you don’t write Javascript with camelCase?
I'm having some CSS issues on an old page and a new one I'm building. The CSS style file is being applied to all pages under the domain name.
It looks like only half the styles are being applied.
The page was fine a few days ago but when I created the new page and template things went weird.
Anyone else experiencing a similar issue?
no some reason I went all underscores a while back. I honestly think it was all the wordpress stuff I was doing. So I only do camelcase now if that is what the project is doing
We tend to follow whatever the language prefers. So Python is snake_case, Java and JavaScript is camelCase. CSS is kebob-case.
It could be an error in your css try opening it up and publishing it again
I just changed my CSS from compressed to compact and that seemed to work... But I also republished my CSS quite a few times before.

There are a lot of caching issues in the Design Manager that crop up and then go away lately. I’m seeing them again this week where stuff is just not updated on published pages. So keep that in mind, but I know they’re working on it.
If you have reproducible test cases for publishing CSS and not seeing it update, please get in touch. This one has been tricky to test.
Lol, how much time you got?

Will do. I’ve been chatting with Matt a lot about past issues. Before Thanksgiving it was with the Preview that would not update and revert. Now the Preview is the one to go off of because published pages are pulling CSS that I know has been changed.
When I have an issue I don't have time to mess with it / report it -- unless its at the end of the day. Otherwise I just have to make a new file and move on.
:disappointed:
that’s fair. If you do have time, let us know as we really want to fix it and the more cases we have the easier it is to pinpoint
3 cheers for <@U25C6PU56> who was able to reliably demonstrate the CSS caching issue and enable me to submit a fix!
this. is. amazing.
Alrighty, that fix is rolled out. Let me know if you see any more instances of this problem.
